page.title: 03Bideford:S+SE.Attractions.
page.content: The valleys of both rivers,together with the smaller valleys of the streams joining them ,have been designated in the Devon County Plan as Areas of Great Landscape Value.Historical interest can be found,in the remains of lime kilns alongside the river,the Turnpike road of 1826 (now A386),with tollhouse at Landcross,the remains of the Rolle can- al of the same date,and the railway which superseded it,now itself disused (except for the iron bridge used by Tor -ridge anglers).The two village church- es are listed buildings and many of the farmsteads and other rural dwellings are interesting.Apart from the A386 and two other small sections of highway,the roads are of County Class 111 or unclas -sified standard,many of them winding, sunken,overhung by trees,and edged with rich verges and hedgerows.Herons at low tide outnumber the boats at full tide.
